did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Account of work done to the Capitol: receipts and vouchers, 1856

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Auditor of Public Accounts, Account of work done to the Capitol: receipts and vouchers, 1856. Accession APA 654. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records are part of Auditor of Public Accounts. Administration of State Government: State-Owned Property - Capitol Square. An act passed by the General Assembly on 18 March 1856 appropriated $1,000 for "repairs and fixtures" for the capitol building. This series contains receipts and vouchers for the work done. Each receipt contains the date, the amount received, the name of the person from whom the money was received, and the reason for the payment. The vouchers include the names of persons to whom money was owed, the amounts, and the dates the vouchers were submitted.
